text: وقال الذين كفروا۟ لا تسمعوا۟ لهذا القرءان والغوا۟ فيه لعلكم تغلبون

translations.translation: Those who are kafir say, 'Do not listen to this Qur'an. Drown it out so that hopefully you will gain the upper hand.'
The disbelievers say: "Do not listen to this Qur'an, and shout away (its reading); you may haply prevail."
The deniers of the Truth say: “Do not give ear to the Qur'an and cause interruption when it is recited; thus perhaps you will gain the upper hand.”
The disbelievers say, "Do not listen to this Quran but make a lot of unnecessary noise while it is being read so that perhaps you will defeat it".
And the disbelievers said, “Do not listen to this Qur’an and engulf it in noise – perhaps you may be victorious this way.”
And those who disbelieve say: "Listen not to this Qur'an, and make noise in the midst of its (recitation) that you may overcome."
And those who disbelieve say: Do not listen to this Quran and make noise therein, perhaps you may overcome.
The unbelievers say, 'Do not give ear to this Koran, and talk idly about it; haply you will overcome.
Those who disbelieve say: Heed not this Qur'an, and drown the hearing of it; haply ye may conquer.
Those who deny the truth say, "Do not listen to this Quran. Drown it out with noise, so that you may gain the upper hand."
And those who disbelieve say: hearken not Unto this Qur'an and babble therein, haply ye may overcome.
The faithless say, ‘Do not listen to this Quran and hoot it down so that you may prevail [over the Apostle].’
The Unbelievers say: "Listen not to this Qur'an, but talk at random in the midst of its (reading), that ye may gain the upper hand!"
And those who disbelieve say: "Listen not to this Quran, and make noise in the midst of its (recitation) that you may overcome."
The unbelievers say: 'Do not listen to this Koran, and talk idly about it so that you might be overcome'
Those who disbelieve say, “Do not listen to this Quran, and talk over it, so that you may prevail.”
And those who disbelieve say, "Do not listen to this Qur'an and speak noisily during [the recitation of] it that perhaps you will overcome."

[41:26] And those who disbelieve say, during the Prophet’s (s) recitation [of the Qur’ān], ‘Do not listen to this Qur’ān and hoot it down, make a din and so forth, and clamour whenever he is reciting, that perhaps you might prevail’, so that he will then desist from recitation.

(Those who disbelieve) the disbelievers of Mecca, Abu Jahl and his host (say: Heed not this Qur'an) which is recited to you by Muhammad (pbuh) (and drown the hearing of it) by causing uproar; (haply ye may conquer) Muhammad (pbuh) and make him keep quiet.

commentaries.author: زيد بن علي
commentaries.text: وقوله تعالى: { وَقَالَ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُواْ لاَ تَسْمَعُواْ لِهَـٰذَا ٱلْقُرْآنِ وَٱلْغَوْاْ فِيهِ } معناه اكثِروا من اللغطِ والصَّخبِ، حتى لا يسمَعهُ سَامعٌ

commentaries.author: الجيلاني
commentaries.text: { وَ } من شدة غيهم وضلالهم والمفضي إلى الخسران العظيم { قَالَ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُواْ } بك وبدينك وبكتابك - يا أكمل الرسل - حين تلاوتك وتبليغك عليهم آيات القرآن { لاَ تَسْمَعُواْ لِهَـٰذَا ٱلْقُرْآنِ } ولا تلفتوا إلى محمد حين قرأ، بل { وَٱلْغَوْاْ فِيهِ } بالصياح، وإنشاد الأشعار، وخلط الأصوات والخرفات { لَعَلَّكُمْ تَغْلِبُونَ } [فصلت: 26] محمداً، وتدفعون قراءتهم، وتخجلونه فيسكت

commentaries.author: ابن عجيبة
commentaries.text:
يقول الحق جلّ جلاله: { وقال الذين كفروا } من رؤساء المشركين لأتباعهم، أو: بعضهم لبعض: { لا تسمعوا لهذا القرآنِ } إذا قُرىء، أي: لا تنصتوا له لأنه يقلب القلوب، ويسبي العقول، وكل مَن استمع إليه صبا إليه، { والْغَوْا فيه لعلكم تَغْلِبون } أي: عارضوه بكلام غير مفهوم، أو: بالخرافات من الرّجَز والشعر والتصدية، وارفعوا أصواتكم بها { لعلكم تغلبون } أي: تغلبونه على قراءته، وشوِّشوا عليه فيقع في الغلط، أو: لا يسمعه منه أحد
 واللغو: الساقط من الكلام الذي لا طائلَ تحته
